summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a FOIA request from Bloomberg News. The request seeks the identity of a financial institution (referred to as "Institution-1") mentioned in a court filing related to the assets of Jeffrey Epstein. The email indicates the request is likely exempt from disclosure and that a specific individual is now handling all FOIA requests for the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case and FOIA request; the request concerns assets controlled by him.

events.title: Criminal case filed against Jeffrey Epstein by SDNY
events.description: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York brought a criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Court filing referencing "Institution-1"
events.description: A court filing (Document 11 in case 19-cr-00490) was made that references an unnamed financial institution concerning Epstein's assets.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A FOIA request from Bloomberg News seeks the name of a financial institution ("Institution-1") referenced in a July 12, 2019 court filing about Jeffrey Epstein's assets.
The email indicates the FOIA request is "very likely covered by exemption" and suggests it will not be fulfilled.
A specific individual (name redacted) is now handling all FOIA requests for the Epstein case directly for the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The underlying criminal case is U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein, case number 19-cr-00490.
The email shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office to manage media requests related to the Epstein case.
